fields.label: Themes
fields.message: "Theme" refers to the items against a light or dark background. For example: "Interactive - Light theme" refers to all interactive elements against a light background.

fields.label: Layer 1
fields.name: layer_1
fields.instructions: Layers refer to content stacked on top of other content. For example, Layer 1 refers to the background color of containers against the general background of the website. Layer 2 refers to the background color of a container against layer 1.

fields.label: Looking to change fonts?
fields.message:
This section is to only adjust the scale of your typography between your titles, headings, paragraphs, and buttons. If you would like to change the overall font of your website, Wordpress requires you to do that in a different section. Please visit: 

Appearance > Editor > Styles > Typography

fields.label: Typography scale
fields.name: typography_scale
fields.instructions:
High Contrast: More pronounced difference between headings and body text.
Medium Contrast: Balanced differences.
Low Contrast: Subtle differences between font sizes.

For example, with High contrast, a paragraph font size of 16 pixels would result in a title/heading size of 120px where with Low contrast, the title/heading size would be 47px.
